intro: Psychotria veillonii, commonly known as the Veillon's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It produces small, fleshy berries that are typically red or orange when mature. Psychotria veillonii is often found in understory habitats and is adapted to thrive in shaded, moist environments.
